title: Connector
description: A resource that represents the configuration of a connector.

entityType.title: Entity Type
entityType.description: The entity type which data can be ingested for.

source.title: Source
source.description: Represents a combination of the configuration to fetch data & selectors to extract content from the raw data.

sourceConfig.title: Source Configuration
sourceConfig.description: Configuration for various sources of data.

selectors.title: Selectors
selectors.description: An ordered list of selectors to apply and extract data.

transforms.title: Transforms
transforms.description: Transforms to sequentially apply to data produced by selectors.

items.title: Transform
items.description: A transform to apply to the data output by the previous step.

mappings.title: Mapping
mappings.description: The mapping generated by the transformers.

scheduleConfig.title: Schedule Config
scheduleConfig.description: The configuration of the run schedule.

useSourceSchedule.title: Use Source Schedule
useSourceSchedule.description: Indicates that the Connector should run automatically using the data source's schedule.

crawlerConfig.title: Crawler Configuration
crawlerConfig.description: Configuration used to extract data from the crawler.

crawler.description: The reference to the crawler resource.

urlPatterns.title: URL Patterns
urlPatterns.description: List of URL patterns to extract data for.

items.description: The URL to extract data for.

apiPullConfig.title: API Pull Configuration
apiPullConfig.description: Configuration used to connect and pull data from an API.

authentication.title: Authentication
authentication.description: The authentication mechanism to use to connect to the API.

bearerToken.title: Bearer Token
bearerToken.description: A token that will be passed in the authorization header.

paginationControl.title: Pagination Control
paginationControl.description: The method used for controlling pagination.

maxPageCount.title: Max Page Count
maxPageCount.description: Max pages to fetch. If unset, all pages will be fetched.

headers.title: Headers
headers.description: Map of header keys and values to use in the API request.

queryParams.title: Query Parameters
queryParams.description: Map of query parameter keys and values to use in the API request.

apiPushConfig.title: API Push Configuration
apiPushConfig.description: Configuration used to connect to an app and push data from an API.

app.description: The reference to the app resource.

apiKey.title: API Key
apiKey.description: An api key will be used to authenticate requests. The API-key can be appended in the header or as a query param depending on the source API.

key.title: Key
key.description: The key used to send the token.

setAsHeader.title: Set As Header
setAsHeader.description: Indicates if the token should be set as a header instead of a query param.

pageBasedPagination.title: Page-Based Pagination
pageBasedPagination.description: Page-based pagination will increment the Page Key query parameter value until all pages are returned.

pageKey.title: Page Key
pageKey.description: Pagination key to be passed as a query parameter in the request.

pageStartValue.title: Page Key Start Value
pageStartValue.description: Initial value for the Page Key. If specified, this value will be used as the query parameter value for the Page Key in the first request. If not specified, 0 will be used by default.

totalPages.title: Total Pages
totalPages.description: Points to the total number of pages either in the response body or the response headers.

key.title: Key
key.description: The key for the total number of pages. A JMES path expression.

inHeader.title: Value is in Response Header
inHeader.description: Indicates if the total number pages value is located in the response headers or the response body.

limitKey.title: Limit Key
limitKey.description: Key to specify the max number of entries returned per page, passed as a query parameter in the request.

limitValue.title: Limit Value
limitValue.description: Value for the Limit Key which specifies the max number of entries returned per page.

cursorPagination.title: Cursor Pagination
cursorPagination.description: Cursor-based pagination will look for a cursor in each response and pass it to the subsequent request to fetch the next page.

pageKey.title: Page Key
pageKey.description: Pagination key to be passed as a query parameter in the request.

cursor.title: Cursor
cursor.description: The key that contains the cursor in the response.  If detectCursorInHeader is set to true, the key will be searched for in the header.  If not set or set to false, the key will be searched for in the response body.

cursorType.title: Cursor Type
cursorType.description: Indicates if the cursor is a Token, Relative URL or Full URL.

detectCursorInHeader.title: Detect Cursor in Header
detectCursorInHeader.description: Indicates if the Cursor key will be contained in the response header or the response body.

dataFormat.title: Data Format
dataFormat.description: The data format of the response.

inputHeaders.title: Input Headers
inputHeaders.description: Specifies which columns should have their values transformed.

headers.title: Headers
headers.description: The names of the columns containing values to transform.

items.title: Header
items.description: The name of the column containing values to transform.

allColumns.title: All Columns
allColumns.description: True if all columns should be transformed, including any added in the future.

valueToFind.title: Value to Find
valueToFind.description: The pattern or text to be replaced.

plainText.title: Plain Text
plainText.description: A literal text value to be matched. If the value is the empty string, only empty cells in the table will be matched.

ignoreCase.title: Ignore Case
ignoreCase.description: True if matching should be case-insensitive, false otherwise.

regex.title: Regex
regex.description: Regular expression to be matched (in accordance with the java.util.regex engine).

fixCapitalization.title: Fix Capitalization
fixCapitalization.description: Transforms the text of the inputted columns by applying the selected capitalization options.

cleanOption.title: Clean Option
cleanOption.description: How the data should be cleaned.

removeUnwantedChars.title: Unwanted Characters Removal
removeUnwantedChars.description: Transforms the text of the input columns by applying the selected character removal options.

cleanOptions.title: Clean Options
cleanOptions.description: How the data should be cleaned.

items.title: Unwanted Character Removal Options
items.description: The unwanted character removal options to be applied.

extractText.title: Extract Text
extractText.description: Transforms the text of the input column by extracting text and creating a new column.

inputHeader.title: Input Column Header
inputHeader.description: The header of the column from which text should be extracted

newColumnHeader.title: New Column Header
newColumnHeader.description: The header for the new column that will be populated with extracted data

extractOperation.title: The Extraction Operation
extractOperation.description: The strategy to be used when determining the quantity of text to extract.

extractFrom.title: The Extraction Location
extractFrom.description: From where the extraction operation should occur

offsetLength.title: The Extraction Offset
offsetLength.description: How many characters from the starting point that the extraction should begin.

maxLengthTextToKeep.title: The Extraction Length
maxLengthTextToKeep.description: The max number of characters that should be extracted. No limit if 0.

plugin.title: Plugin
plugin.description: Invokes a Plugin function to transform values.

plugin.title: Plugin
plugin.description: The reference to a Plugin resource.

findAndReplace.title: Find and Replace
findAndReplace.description: Finds a specified pattern or text and replaces it with a specified value.

replacement.title: Replacement
replacement.description: The text that will replace all found matches.

addColumn.title: Add Column
addColumn.description: Adds a new column and populate the column with a static value

columnValue.title: Column Value
columnValue.description: The column value to be added.

filterRow.title: Filter Row
filterRow.description: Filters rows based on specified conditionals

action.title: The Row Action
action.description: The action to perform on rows that satisfy the evaluation of rules

rules.title: The Rules to Apply
rules.description: A list of rules to be applied to filter rows.

rule.title: Filter Row Sub Rule
rule.description: A single rule to be applied to filter row.

columnHeader.title: The Column Header
columnHeader.description: The column header to apply the rule.

conditional.title: The Conditional
conditional.description: The conditional to apply. For conditionals that compare values, the value being processed is on the left, and the conditional input is on the right. When data is in the format of numbers or dates in ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD), they will be compared as numbers or dates respectively. Otherwise, they will be compared as strings

conditionalInput.title: The Conditional Input
conditionalInput.description: The conditional input value to apply the conditional against.

formatDates.title: Format Dates
formatDates.description: Formats dates of the specified input into yyyy-MM-dd

inputFormat.title: Input Format
inputFormat.description: The date format pattern of the input values.

mapping.description: The mapping generated by the transformers.

field.title: Field
field.description: The reference to the field resource.

subfieldPath.description: Path to a particular property or list item index.

name.title: Name
name.description: A name which identifies a struct value property.

index.title: Index
index.description: An index which identifies an item in a list value.

header.title: Header
header.description: The header used to identify the extracted content.

mode.description: The selector mode of a CSS or XPath selector.

attributeKey.title: Attribute Key
attributeKey.description: The attribute key of a CSS or XPath selector.

customSchedule.title: Custom Schedule
customSchedule.description: The custom schedule that the connector will follow. The Connector can be configured to run daily, weekly, monthly or a custom frequency. Currently, this is only supported for API Connectors.

timeZone.title: Time Zone
timeZone.description: The time zone in ISO-8601 Zone-ID to start a run, i.e. America/New_York.

startDate.title: Start Date
startDate.description: The local date in ISO format to start scheduling runs, i.e. 2021-01-30.

startTime.title: Start Time
startTime.description: The local time in ISO format to start scheduling runs, i.e. 12:00:00.

repeatInterval.title: Repeat interval
repeatInterval.description: The repeat interval based off the schedule config frequency type. If unset, a repeat interval of 1 will be used (e.g. every day).
